components.description:
The sour, yellow-colored citrus fruit of the lemon, usually with a stem and green leaf or leaves.

Spiked in use thanks to Beyoncé’s 2016 album, Lemonade.
components.title: Lemon

description:
The sour, yellow-colored citrus fruit of the lemon, usually with a stem and green leaf or leaves.

Spiked in use thanks to Beyoncé’s 2016 album, Lemonade.
title: Lemon

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Fruit and vegetable symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A yellow-colored fruit, known for its sour¬†taste. Shown with one or two green leaves on some platforms. Has been used in relation to the Bey http://emojipedia.org/lemon/
emoji_net_data.name: lemon

bn:13764602a: Of, or relating to citrus plants or fruit.

bn:13638873a: Containing or having the flavour/flavor and/or scent of lemons.
Having the flavour/flavor and/or scent of lemons.

bn:13638874a: Of the pale yellow colour/color of lemons.

bn:00110947a: Having an acidic, sharp or tangy taste.
Having an acid, sharp or tangy taste.
Sharp to the taste; acid; sour.

bn:00113968a: Having the colour of a yolk, a lemon or gold.
Of the color intermediate between green and orange in the color spectrum; of something resembling the color of an egg yolk

bn:00093282v: To have a taste; to excite a particular sensation by which flavour is distinguished.

bn:00019301n: Citrus is a common term and genus of flowering plants in the rue family, Rutaceae.
Any of numerous fruits of the genus Citrus having thick rind and juicy pulp; grown in warm regions
The fruits of a plant in the citrus genus. They have a leathery rind surrounding segments filled with pulp vesicles.

The genus Citrus, flowering plants in the family Rutaceae, originally from Southeast Asia. It comprises many plants grown for their juicy and fragrant fruits, such as lemon, orange, lime, and grapefruit.
Fruit of genus in family Rutaceae.
A fruit of a common genus Citrus of flowering plants in the family Rutaceae.
Any of several shrubs or trees of the family Rutaceae.

bn:00036686n: The ripened reproductive body of a seed plant
Fruit, in broad terms, is a structure of a plant that contains its seeds.
The seed-bearing part of a plant, often edible, colourful/colorful and fragrant, produced from a floral ovary after fertilization.
A fully matured plant ovary with or without other floral or shoot parts united with it at maturity.
In botany, a fruit is a part of a flowering plant that derives from specific tissues of the flower, one or more ovaries, and in some cases accessory tissues.

bn:00037175n: A colour resembling that of the lemon; RAL-1012.
A shade of yellow, named for the cereal of the same name
Lemon is a color somewhat resembling yellow and named after the lemon fruit.
The color maize or corn refers to a shade of yellow; it is named for the cereal of the same name -- maize.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the lemon emoji is a vibrant, sunny yellow sphere with a slightly textured rind, rendered with Apple's signature glossy 3D shading. Its smooth, rounded shape and realistic lighting make it appear plump and refreshing, evoking a sense of zest and brightness. This emoji is commonly used to represent citrus fruits, tartness, or a refreshing taste in messages.
